result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on November 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Probation Intake Form

11:12 AM Defendant Abril Lara in court.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Abril Lara.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and no contest to counts 2 and 3. Count #1 HELD OPEN - If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss count 1 only. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 and 3 and orders sentence withheld 1 year probation on each count. Defendant must report to probation today. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 4 days.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
